title.narrative: 002 RURAL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of rural communities to provide and maintain adequate and sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene services, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Ethiopian population living in healthy environments, using safe drinking water and adequate sanitation services , and practicing hygiene increased

participating-org.narrative: AFAR REGIONAL DISASTER PREVENTION F SECURITY AND PROGRAMME COORDINATION OFFICE

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity of rural communities to provide and maintain adequate and sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene services

description.narrative: UNICEF's concept proofed the application of “Three Phased Approach” to identify potential sites for groundwater drilling in areas where drilling success rate is low. The successful approach is being scald up to other regions and will be a useful way to design and implement resilient WASH. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: No. of users of new or rehabilitated water schemes

actual.value: 2016:3,366,035 people are provided with potable water. (129% of the planned result for CP).

title.narrative: No of new users of household toilets with or without access to hand-washing stand with soap / ash (disaggregated as basic and improved)

actual.value: 2016:4,481,349 people gained access to self-constructed latrine facilities which is more than the planned result of 2.5 million for the country program. (179% of the planned results for CP).

title.narrative: No of institutions with improved and gender sensitive WASH facilities disaggregated by access to water and sanitation facilities in health facilities and schools

actual.value: 2016:377 Health Facilities provided with complete WASH package which is 82% of the planned result for CP.

title.narrative: No. of ODF Kebeles/villages with ODF populations

actual.value: 2016:11,079 villages became ODF which is 158% of the national target for the country program of 7,000 ODF villages.
